snippet: Aid officials are preparing to add Yemen to the ranks of the world’s most severe humanitarian crises and human rights groups point to what may be war crimes.
abstract: Saudi-led military coalition is facing rising pressure as it tries to stop Houthi rebels in Yemen; United Nations is poised to declare country in severe humanitarian crisis and human rights group say situation may involve of war crimes; diplomats say military blockage on commercial ships is choking supply of food and fuel into poorest nation in Arab world.

byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukallah, Yemen; Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Yemen; and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Aid officials are preparing to add Yemen to the ranks of the world’s most severe humanitarian crises and human rights groups point to what may be war crimes.

headline.main: Pressure Mounting on Saudis’ Coalition in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Pressure Mounting on Saudis’ Coalition in Yemen

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
